arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany laments “bitter” ending to 3-2 win over FC St. Pauli
arts.sum: “St. Pauli is a well organised team and don’t concede many goals and chances,” said Kompany (via @iMiaSanMia ). On Saturday, Bayern Munich stretched their lead atop the Bundesliga table back to six points after a 3-2 home win against FC St. Pauli.

arts.ttl: Bayern 3-2 St Pauli (29 de Mar., 2025) Resultado Final
arts.sum: In addition to the above toggle, you may choose to provide the information requested in this opt-out form, which may enable us to take action on your opt-out election more broadly than just on this digital property. Please note that, because these activities are based on online cookies, your opt-out choice is specific to this property.

arts.ttl: Leroy Sané speaks out on his future following brace in Bayern Munich’s 3-2 win over FC St. Pauli
arts.sum: Bayern Munich faced a tricky game against St. Pauli but overcame the challenge thanks to a strong Leroy Sané brace, helping the Rekordmeister win 3-2. Following the game, Sané discussed his performance and the win.

arts.ttl: Canada defends Alphonso Davies treatment amid Bayern anger
arts.sum: The Canadian soccer federation has defended its handling of star player Alphonso Davies after his club Bayern Munich threatened to take legal action in the aftermath of his serious injury suffered during the Concacaf Nations League finals last week. "Medical documentation confirms that proper care protocols were followed, and communication records show that our medical staff provided updates to Bayern Munich throughout the entire tournament," Canada Soccer said in a statement reported by Canadian media.

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich sheds light on Leon Goretzka’s substitution vs. FC St. Pauli
arts.sum: Speaking after the game, Bayern sporting director Christoph Freund assured fans that the substitution wasn’t a cause for concern. Christoph Freund says Leon Goretzka was subbed off with a back problem as a precaution at half time - nothing serious

arts.ttl: Harry Kane sets two incredible milestones as he closes in on first career trophy
arts.sum: Bayern Munich are closing in on the Bundesliga title after their 3-2 win over St Pauli, inspired by their star striker Harry Kane - who scored and assisted during the game

arts.ttl: More injury problems for Bayern Munich as Hiroki Ito appears to re-aggravate injury
arts.sum: Bayern Munich sporting director Christoph Freund and head coach Vincent Kompany were not optimistic about the injury suffered by Hiroki Ito when speaking to Sky Germany on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Leroy Sané shines as Bayern Munich edge past spirited St. Pauli in five-goal thriller
arts.sum: Bayern Munich defeated St. Pauli 3-2 in a thrilling Matchday 27 encounter, with Leroy Sané scoring twice and Harry Kane back on the scoresheet as Vincent Kompany's side took an important step forward in the title race. Elias Saad celebrates his equalizer with St. Pauli teammates Jackson Irvine and Manolis Saliakas, bringing the score level against Bayern Munich.

arts.ttl: European football: Bayern battle past St Pauli with Sané’s second-half double
arts.sum: Harry Kane also on the scoresheet to regain six-point lead Real Madrid in action later on Saturday against Leganes Leroy Sané scored twice in the second half as Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich were made to work hard for a 3-2 win over visitors St Pauli on Saturday to restore their six-point gap at the top going into the last seven matchdays. Bayern, who face Inter in their Champions League quarter-final first leg on 8 April, took a 17th-minute lead when Harry Kane tapped in from Michael Olise’s cross. Kane, who leads the Bundesliga top scorers’ list with 22 goals, has now scored against all 19 clubs he has faced in the Bundesliga, the second best all-time record behind the retired Miroslav Klose. This article will be updated later on Saturday Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Bayern hold off St. Pauli, keep title tilt on track
arts.sum: Leroy Sane scored twice in the second half as Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich were made to work hard for a 3-2 win over visitors St Pauli on Saturday.
